author: wired blogs
text: date: thu 12/16/1999 11:17 am from: dave (ietm@telusplanet.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: re: choosing names a taxing battleso walmart figures everyone should play fair now. ("choosing names a taxing battle," 16.dec.1999). i guess we should all feel sorry for such poor downtrodden mainstream folk now that they are experiencing a little competition. i wonder how many "mom and pop" businesses wal-mart put under in their unbridled expansion into every locality in north america. i welcome e-commerce with open arms. if we can keep the government pawns at bay, it might just be the beginning of a new world order. imagine open borders with no regulation and businesses that are forced to actually supply goods that people needed or wanted at a competitive price in order to survive. personally, i think the moribund bastards are too late. e-commerce has a life force of its own. it will not tolerate the self-serving protectionist regulation by rich powerbrokers that has historically characterized traditional commerce throughout the world.
